About Us.title: Who is ADP?
About Us.p1: ADP is PT. Adyabina Putramas, Indonesia leading polymer distributor that specialises in the supply of commodity plastics, engineering plastics, super engineering plastics, coating and additives.
About Us.p2: ADP has presence across South-East Asia more than 30 years, and works with a broad network of industry leading producers to offer a one-stop solution to cover all your needs.

Automotive.title: Automotive
Automotive.p1: We serve a range of applications in the automotive industry especially 4 Wheel including interior and exterior elements, lighting, engine parts, seating and electric vehicle battery (EVB) packaging, using dedicated raw materials for coatings and adhesives, thermoplastics, foams, films, composites and more.
Automotive.p2: We also serve a range of applications for 2 Wheel including lighting, seating, handbrake and electric vehicle battery (EVB) packaging, and more.

Consumer Goods.title: Consumer Goods
Consumer Goods.p1: We provide liquid polymers and alcohol polyurethane solutions for multiple cosmetic and personal care applications.
Consumer Goods.p2: We have many products for the construction market such as insulation, flooring, roofs, walls, facades, doors, windows or pipelines.
Consumer Goods.p3: We supply raw materials for a range of applications including footwear, sports equipment, goggles and wearables, functional textiles and artificial leather.
Consumer Goods.p4: We provide raw materials for thermoplastics, foams, films, elastomers, TPU, composites and more for any range home appliance applications.

Electrical & Electronics.title: Electrical & Electronics
Electrical & Electronics.p1: In electrical and electronics applications we serve many range but especially we provide raw materials for Fiber Optic Cable.

Healthcare.title: Healthcare
Healthcare.p1: We supply thermoplastics, films, TPU, raw materials for adhesives, foams, and more for healthcare applications such as medication delivery, surgical instruments, electromedical equipment and wound care.

Chemical & Paints.title: Chemical & Paints
Chemical & Paints.p1: We supply a comprehensive selection of raw materials for highly demanding chemical & paints formulations used for architectual coatings, automotive and commercial vehicle coatings or industrial coatings.

Aerospace & Transportation.title: Aerospace & Transportation
Aerospace & Transportation.p1: All activities of aerospace or transportation rely on advanced engine and propulsion technologies requiring parts that operate in the most extreme conditions while meeting stringent specifications.
Aerospace & Transportation.p2: We understands that & supply best quality materials for this industry.

Energy & Resources.title: Energy & Resources
Energy & Resources.p1: Last but not least, we provide energy & resources industry applications such as solar panels, energy storage or wind blades and towers, thanks to our dedicated raw materials for coatings, elastomers, polyurethane resins, TPU and more.

HIPS.name: HIPS (High Impact Polystyrene)
HIPS.desc: High Impact Polystyrene (HIPS) is a low cost, tough plastic that is easy to thermoform and fabricate.

GPPS.name: GPPS (General Purpose Polystyrene)
GPPS.desc: Transparent polymers resulting from the polymerization of Styrene Monomer. GP Polystyrene can be used for both injection moulding and extrusion applications.

EPS.name: EPS (Expandable Polystyrene)
EPS.desc: It is usually white, foamy and made of pre-expanded polystyrene beads. Very lightweight with very low thermal conductivity, low moisture absorption and excellent cushioning properties.

HPP.name: Homopolymer PP (Polypropylene)
HPP.desc: The most widely utilized general-purpose grade. It contains only propylene monomer in a semi-crystalline solid form.

BCPP.name: Block Copolymer PP
BCPP.desc: Contains a higher ethene content (between 5 and 15%). It has co-monomer units arranged in a regular pattern (or blocks). Suitable for applications requiring high strength (Industries).

HDPE.name: HDPE (High Density Polyethylene)
HDPE.desc: A thermoplastic polymer produced from the monomer ethylene. It is sometimes called "alkathene" or "polythene" when used for HDPE pipes.

LDPE.name: LDPE (Low Density Polyethylene)
LDPE.desc: A thermoplastic made from the monomer ethylene. It was the first grade of polyethylene.

LLDPE.name: LLDPE (Linear Low Density Polyethylene)
LLDPE.desc: A substantially linear polymer (polyethylene), with significant numbers of branches, commonly made by copolymerization of ethylene with longer-chain olefins.

PVC.name: PVC (Polyvinyl Chloride)
PVC.desc: The world's third-most widely produces synthetic plastic polymer (after polyethylene and polypropylene). Comes in two basic forms: rigid (RPVC) and flexible.

PET.name: PET (Polyethylene Terephthalate)
PET.desc: The most common thermoplastic polymer resin of the polyester family.

EVA.name: EVA (Ethylene-vinyl Acetate)
EVA.desc: Also known as poly (ethylene-vynil acetate) (PEVA), is the copolymer of ethylene and vynil acetate.

PC.name: PC (Polycarbonate)
PC.desc: A group of thermoplastic polymers containing carbonate groups in their chemical structures. Used in engineering are strong, tough materials, and some grades are optically transparent.

POM.name: POM (Polyoxymethylene or Polyacetal)
POM.desc: An engineering thermoplastic used in precision parts requiring high stiffness, low friction, and excellent dimentional stability.

NYLON.name: Polyamide 6 and 6.6 (Nylon)
NYLON.desc: Not a condensation polymer, but instead is formed by ring-opening polymerization; this makes it a special case in the comparison between condensation and addition polymers.

PBT.name: PBT (Polybutylene Terephtalate)
PBT.desc: A thermoplastic engineering polymer that is used as an insulator in the electrical and electronics industries. It's thermoplastic (semi-) crystalline polymer, and a type of polyester.

ABS.name: ABS (Acrylonitrile Butadiene Styrene)
ABS.desc: A highly-functional plastic known for its strong heat resistance and impact resistance. It is highly processable abd can be manufactured in various colors.

SAN.name: SAN (Styrene Acrylonitrile)
SAN.desc: A copolymer plastic consisting of styrene and acrylonitrile. It is widely used in place of polystyrene owing ot its greater thermal resistance.

MABS.name: MABS (Methyl Methacrylate - Acrylotrile - Butadiene - Styrene)
MABS.desc: An amorphous thermoplastic polymer, which is a copolymer of methyl methacrylate (MMA), styrene, acrylonitrile, and butadiene.

ASA.name: ASA (Acrylonitrile Styrene Acrylate)
ASA.desc: An amorphous thermoplastic polymer, which is an amorphous plastic developed as an alternative to acrolonitrile butadine styrene (ABS), but with improved weather resistance.

PETG.name: PETG (Polyethylene Terephthalate Glycol)
PETG.desc: A clear thermoplastic that can be formed into many shapes, making it suitable for use in many applications.

PMMA.name: PMMA (Polymetyl Methacrylate)
PMMA.desc: Also known as acrylic, acrylic glass, or plexiglass, as well as by the trade name Crylux, Plexiglas, Acrylite, Lucite, Perclax, and Perspex.

TP.name: Thermoplastic Polymer
TP.desc: A plastic polymer material that becomes pliable or moldable at a certain elevated temperature and solidifies upon cooling.

SBC.name: SBC (Styrene Butadiene Copolymer)
SBC.desc: Copolymers of Styrene Monomer and Butadiene Rubber. They bring with them excellent clarity, good impact and easy processing.

PAC.name: Polymer Alloys and Compounds
PAC.desc: ADP continously providing new materials fulfilling various requirements from the market which is ceaselessly getting diversified and sophisticated, applying the advantaged knowledge and technology about polymer alloys.

PPS.name: PPS (Polyphenylene Sulfide)
PPS.desc: An organic polymer consisting of aromatic rings linked by sulfides. One of the most important high temperature thermoplastic polymers, it exhibits a number of desirable properties.

PPA.name: PPA (Polyphenylene Sulfide)
PPA.desc: An aromatic polyamide the outperforms standard polyamides with higher strength and stiffness. used to replace metal in high-temperature automotive applications.

PTFE.name: PTFE (Polytetrafluoroethylene)
PTFE.desc: A flourocarbon solid, as it is a high molecular weight compound consisting wholly of carbon and fluorine. Used a non-stick coating for pans and other cookware.

PARA.name: PARA (Polyarylamide)
PARA.desc: Offering metal-like strength, rigidity and dimentional stability, the biocompatible PARA polymer also provides an exceptional surface finish.

PVDF.name: PVDF Solef (Polyvinylidene Fluoride)
PVDF.desc: A very low viscosity homopolimer resin mainlu used in injection molding or in multifilamen extursion.

PPSU.name: PPSU (Polyphenylsulfone)
PPSU.desc: A transparent and rigid high-temperature engineering thermoplastic and belongs to polysulfone family.

LCP.name: LCP (Liquid-Crystal Polymers)
LCP.desc: A class of aromatic polymers. They are exremely unreactive and inert, and highly resistant to fire.

PEEK.name: PEEK (Polyether Ether Ketone)
PEEK.desc: A colourless organic thermoplastic polymer in the polyaryletherketone (PAEK) family, used in engineering applications.

Logistic Service.title: Logistic Service
Logistic Service.p1: Dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit, sed diam nonummy nibh euismod tincidunt ut laoreet dolore magna aliquam erat volutpat. Ut wisi enim ad minim veniam.

About.title: About ADP
About.p1: PT. Adyabina Putramas is engineering plastics materials supplier for various industries in Indonesia over 20 Years.
About.p2: We offer a comprehensive products range to fulfill the needs of every clients. Present a number of foreign manufacturers an exclusive basis.
About.p3: We import chemicals and engineering plastic resins and supply to the local manufacturing and plastic injection moulding companies.
